title: The Olafing of Kassadin
body: So after about a dozen nerfs, Kassadin's ult is going be guttered next patch(most likely). What do you think of it? I personally hope that they compensate for him somehow, but I think we all know that won't happen. How do you see him progressing as the patches continue and will he still be viable?

replies.body: I don't get why people hate this Kassadin nerf. I mean, isn't it better to spam your ult more rather than just a "SURPRISE MUTHA..."? And 450 range is more than enough to jump over the skinny walls into lane.

{{champion:76}} 's jump is on a 2-sec cd.

LETS NERF {{champion:38}}

>
> {{champion:76}} 's jump is on a 2-sec cd.
> 
> LETS NERF {{champion:38}}

Kinda tempted to do this again :P

So it's no longer "Better Nerf Irelia!", it's now "Better Nerf Kassadin!"

I can dig that. Irelia is still strong.

Strangely enough, both Irelia and Kassadin are only really problems because of their Passives.

I'm sure Riot would be fine with Kassadin's damage if he didn't also take a large % reduced Magic Damage. And they would be happy with Irelia if she wasn't both a great duellist and also have unnecessary Tenacity that increases per nearby enemy from her passive.
